content.question: The angle in standard position is labeled theta. The initial ray is on the positive x axis and the terminal ray passes through a point on the circle in the third quadrant with coordinates (negative 3 comma negative 4). ​The figure shows a circle in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane with center at the origin, an angle of measure <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in standard position, and the intersection point of the terminal ray. What is the value of <math alttext="sin theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
